{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38134]. {panel} h3. Step to replicate # Insert the storage format in [^test.txt] directly into a Confluence page ( You can use Source Editor to do this) # Edit the Page # Copy The content in the Edit Mode # Create a new page # Paste the Content into the paste. Before the content is copied, the storage format contain font-weight and font-family property: {code}

TEST

{code} However these property are removed once it is pasted in the new content {code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38131].
  {panel}

*Background of the request*

Currently in Confluence, Read notifications are automatically deleted after 2 weeks and Unread notifications are automatically deleted after 4 weeks. We cannot decide how long we want to show and delete the Workbox notification.

*Scenario*
User want to configure/change when the read notification should be deleted.
fields.summary: Option to manually configure workbox notification deletion
Confluence's JIRA Chart macro needs consistent colours
Confluence's JIRA Chart macro needs consistent colours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence Administrator, I would like to configure the 'Attachment Download Security Policy' on a per space basis. At the moment, the setting is applied at a global basis, which does not work if you want attachments to be downloaded/displayed inline depending on the space.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to choose options (e.g. 'Insecure: Display all attachments inline.') for some spaces only while not affecting Confluence globally.
fields.summary: As a Confluence Administrator, I would like to configure the 'Attachment Download Security Policy' on a per space basis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38123].
  {panel}

*+STEPS TO REPRODUCE+*
1. Launch Atlassian Documentation page from Search on JIRA ([Atlassian Doc Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=JIRA&startIndex=0&where=AOD])
2. Type in "JIRA"

*+EXPECTED RESULT+*
Documentation site returns results related to the keyword "JIRA"

*+ACTUAL RESULT+*
Site returns message stating no results found
{noformat}
No results found for JIRA. Please try one of the following suggestions:
Use more general search terms or consult the online documentation for tips.
If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter
{noformat}
fields.summary: Search returns no results on Atlassian Documentation site

I use the following link - https://wiki.labcollab.net/confluence/display/PD/Radius+Weekly+PD+Update

to update my project on a weekly basis.  I was able to see this page yesterday afternoon and attempted to access in the evening and not cannot see the page.  Can someone look into this?

Thanks,
Albert

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38111].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
There is a bug in Confluence (on a Windows machine) when URL is pasted.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Space Tools > Configure Sidebar.
# Click on *Add Link*; then click on *Web link* to add an external web URL to the side bar. 
# Copy any URL.
# Right Click and paste the URL into the text box and save it.

h2.Expected Result
Newly created link should be linking correctly.

h2.Current Result
Newly created link is linking back to the space.

h2.Note
The problem happens when:
* The URL is pasted using the right-click context menu (e.g. Right Click -> Paste).

The problem does *NOT* happen when:
* The URL is pasted using the keyboard shortcut 'Ctrl-V'.
*  The URL is typed in manually.
fields.summary: Copy Paste bug when adding URLs to the space sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38103].
  {panel}

Whenever a user tries to edit the Space Permission and update its information, Confluence fails to do so and report the following error:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}
It happens if the space has given a permission to a group which has a white space in the group name (i.e test group).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Space and create a group with a similar name.
For example:
#* Space: Space test
#* Group: Space test

# Try to update the Space Permission by adding the Space test group.
# Hit Save All.

*Expected behaviour*
# The permissions should be updated.

*Actual*
Nothing happens and all buttons are greyed out.
The following error appears on the console:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}

*Additional info*
Confirmed this will only affect Webkit based browsers, like Google Chrome and Safari.

*Workaround*
Use other browsers, like Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to save changes to Space Permissions for a group containing a whitespace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38096].
  {panel}

At least some users want to indent macro output: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/239977/answers/18812543?flashId=-307643035

Therefore, macros should not produce an automatic linebreak before the actual macro output, but they should use the indent of the "current cursor position", where the macro is positioned.

That way one could simply add spaces before the macro to get indentation.

Moreover, I've often wanted to have some macro output midst of a text or to the right of a text. Also that would then be possible.

h2. Alternative solution
An alternative or additional solution would be to produce macros "Inline" and "PositionHere". 

"PositionHere" macro would position its contents as if the top-left of the page would be the "current cursor position. (So people could place their Code Block or Page Tree into that macro, which could then be indented or to the right of some text.)

"Inline" macro would start the macro output at "current cursor position" but at the right end of the line (and at any linebreak) it would go on from the left. (Even if another macro such as Page Tree inside the Inline macro tries to produce its output as a separate paragraph.)

Thus, "Inline" means simply "Start macro output here as any other text" (or "indent just the first line, to this point", whereas "PositionHere" means "also indent every following line this much"). That would be great for, e.g., using include or Excerpt Include in the middle of a paragraph.

*If the panel macro would have an option for left margin* and/or left padding, that would be* exactly the "PositionHere" macro *(once you make border and background white), provided that there are also top and bottom margin options (I would set them 0). Then it would be just a box in the middle of the page without additional margins.
fields.summary: Macros like Code Block or Page Tree should not produce a linebreak

h3. Summary
When visiting a page in Confluence with JIRA Issues Macro, a stack trace will be seen. 


h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.0-OD-57-010 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit or create a page on the instance with JIRA Issues macro.
# Instead of page loading, you receive below stack trace.

h3. Expected Results
Generally page should load without problem.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
 java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator root
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:202)

caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator page
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:202)

caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getDisplayableItems' in class com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager threw exception net.sf.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: Failed to lazily initialize a collection at template/includes/menu-macros.vm[line 125, column 45]

caused by: net.sf.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: Failed to lazily initialize a collection

Raise a support request in the Atlassian Cloud project at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] to have Support apply the fix to your instance. No downtime is required.

h3. Summary

Dates are not sorted correctly when user is on European browser (such as Deutsch)

h3. Environment
Tested in:
* Confluence server 5.9.1
* Cloud Confluence version 1000.150.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that browser is on English language
# Create a page with random dates in a table
# Save, and try to sort it
# Tables are sorted correctly
# Go to user profile > setting > edit > set language as Deutsch
# Go back to the page > try to sort the dates

h3. Expected Results
Dates are sorted correctly

h3. Actual Results
Dates are not sorted correctly. In fact, it's sorted in a random way. see [GIF attached|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/206841/f0S76Dx2jG.gif]

h3. Notes
This issue is different than CONF-34002 since CONF-34002 is an improvement request for dates to be able to be sorted

The confluence export space to XML and Import space from XML toes NOT include any Look and Feel settings (Color theme) or Template Theme settings.

Furthermore, the IMPORT process does not include the "Default Look And Feel" or Color settings from the Global settings.

As such, an Import Theme and Color Theme is the "default" Atlassian theme/colors.

This is a BUG and you need to fix it.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38073].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently is only possible to create JIRA Issues from Confluence if JIRA has only these fields as required:
* System fields:
** Component
** Fix Versions
** Affect Versions
** Priority
** Due date
** Environment
** Assignee
** Reporter
** Labels
* Custom fields which have these field types such textfield, textarea, URL, number

Some customers need different field types to be required, which prevents this functionality from working.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Confluence and JIRA user, I would like to be able to add different custom fields (' types) as required. Ideally, I'd like to be able to add any custom field I have in my JIRA instance as required, and this field be recognised in Confluence during the issue creation.
fields.summary: Ability to create issues with required custom fields that aren't default field types

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38067].
  {panel}

It would be very powerful to allow the JIRA Issues macro to use variables. 

Another way to phrase this would be allowing end users who don't have permission to edit a page configure the results of the macro. 

Another use case would be the curator of a page providing a JIRA Issues Macro that could be used to track the results across a few different projects, allowing the user to select one. 

A third use case would be automatically passing in the user accessing the page as a variable, and returning results relevant to them.

It is known that anybody who is in the confluence-administrator group can access any restricted spaces. Since we have an [improvement request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4616] to remove the confluence-administrator's privileges(_to access any space_),  a customer [suggested in a ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-150378] to restrict spaces using passwords, in that way, confluence administrators won't be able to access sensitive content as we have some tickets and [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/4162/restrict-viewing-for-confluence-administrators] regarding this kind of issue.

Steps to replicate:

# Create a new Space.
# Create a _test_ group
# Restrict the space only for the _test_ group.
# Access the space using the _admin_ user

h2. Improvement
Would like the option to display, above or below the macro, a list of all the labels used for all the attachments. 

For example, (Using numbers to indicate labels and letters to indicate attachments) if I had 3 attachments with the following labels:
AAA: 124
BBB: 321
CCC: 678, 124
I want a list at the top of the macro that says "124, 321, 678". 

It would be ideal if you could click on any given label to filter the attachments to only show attachments that have that label. So, to continue the example, if I clicked on 124 on the top, just AAA and CCC would be shown.  


h2. Use Case
This would help people use consistent label names when labeling new attachments, and allow people to know what terms to filter on.

Label List Macro does not fit this need. {quote}tried to use Labels List, but as you indicated it lists all labels within the space. I want to be able to limit the list to the page (our space is large and listing all labels is unruly and makes it harder rather than easier to figure out what is on the page).{quote}
fields.summary: Space Attachments Macro - Display a List of Labels with the Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38037].
  {panel}

As a space administrator, I want to be able to limit WHO (user or group) can use a specific template so that I can restrict certain content types to specific users or groups.

Use case:
We use Confluence for our corporate intranet. In general, we want the intranet to be open and editable by all in order to increase collaboration and knowledge sharing (space editing permission for all). However, on the landing page, we pull in news and newsletters (content by label macro), which we target to different groups (show if macro).

I have created templates for news (corporate-wide, EMEA news, Denmark news, etc), which ensure the right labels are on each news item so that it is presented to the right audience.

So far, so good.

However I really want to limit who can use those templates. Only specific people can create company-wide news, only people in Denmark can create DK news, etc. Right now I hide Create from Template buttons in the show if macro, but anyone who clicks *Create* can see all the templates and create whatever they want.

My HR overlords would be so pleased if we could actually restrict access to the templates

:-)
fields.summary: Ability to restrict who can use a template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38035].
  {panel}

On IE10 or IE11, "Edit in Office" opens the file in Office correctly the first time you click on the option. Then you save or close the Office document and back on Confluence, clicking again on "Edit in Office" nothing happens.

In order to use the functionality again the IE window has to be closed and reopened.

*Environment:*
- Windows 7 
- MS Office 2010 (no compatibility pack is installed)
- Java, via *Programs and Features* versions are :
-- Java 7 Update 71 (64bit) v7.0.710
-- Java SE Development Kit 7 Update 71 (64bit) v1.7.0.710
-- Java 6 Update 21 v6.0.210
-- Java 6 Update 39 (64bit) v6.0.390
- Browsers
-- IE11
-- IE10

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Add Word 2010 document to a page. (a one sentence document would do)
# Click on "Edit in Office" and after entering your Confluence credentials the file will be opened in Office Word 2010
# Save then Close the document in Word.
# Click on "Edit in Office".

*Expected Result:* The document is once again opened in Office Word 2010
*Actual Result:* Nothing happens. No errors displayed on screen.

Confluence logs an error: (full confluence-log.txt attached)
{noformat}
 2015-06-19 11:38:01,787 ERROR [TP-Processor36] [extra.webdav.servlet.ConfluenceWebdavServlet] service Unexpected error
  -- url: /wiki/plugins/servlet/confluence/editinword/13139974/attachments/SimpleWordDocument.docx | userName: user-name
 org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.DavException: Precondition Failed
 	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.lock.SerializableLockManager.releaseLock(SerializableLockManager.java:185)
 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractConfluenceResource.unlock(AbstractConfluenceResource.java:416)
 	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.server.AbstractWebdavServlet.doUnlock(AbstractWebdavServlet.java:709)
{noformat}
but the problem is when clicking the option a second time. The first time it opens correctly which proves that the [Office Connector Prerequisites|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Office+Connector+Prerequisites] are met.

IE Private Mode exhibits the exact same behaviour.

*Workaround:*
Close Internet Explorer and reopen it again to use the "Edit in Office" functionality again.
fields.summary: "Edit in Office" fails to open file on the second attempt on IE10 and IE11

h3. Problem Definition
For long running Space Exports using Content Tool Export, would like the ability to navigate off the Export Progress Page and still be able to gather the file(s) when the Export completes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37980].
  {panel}

The two fields in the *Insert link* and *Edit link* dialog under *Web link* are labeled "_Address_" and "_Link text_". The second label with the word "Link" is misleading. People who just scan screens (most!) will see the word "Link" and think that's where the URL goes.

Also, it is more common to have the text/label _first_, and the address/URL _second_. Because of these two things, I always have to pause and _think_ when I come to this dialog (and I use it a lot!). 

I recommend: 
# Swap the order (URL field is second)
# Add placeholder text to the URL field, e.g. "http://www.example.com"
# Change the labels so there's no ambiguity. Either of these is better:
* Text to display
* Address
or 
* Text
* Link

I've attached a mock-up of how this could look. 

Thanks for listening! :)
fields.summary: Field labels in the Insert/Edit Link dialog Web Link section are confusing

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, users can create JIRA issues from a table in a Confluence page, and, if a link to an epic exists in the page, link new issues to that epic. In case the page contains links to more epics, though, the option isn't available anymore and issues need to be linked manually.

fields.summary: Allow Users to Select an Epic to Link New Stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37962].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Linking Confluence page using [linking feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Links#WorkingwithLinks-Linktospecifictypesofcontent] will create a dynamic link that still work if the content is moved or updated (page, blog or attachment).

However, this is not the case if Confluence user link the content using Web URL. When such link created, Confluence won't be able to modify the link to point to the correct content if its moved or change as the URL to access the content will be changed in the process as well.

h3. Suggested Solution

Confluence should provide a warning that creating such link could leads to issues in the future by applying the warning in the "Web link" pop up window as can be seen below:

!warning.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User should receive a warning not to link Confluence content using Web URL in "Insert Link" Window

h3. Summary
When exporting large pages to PDF, there's a performance issue. When Confluence starts converting said page to PDF, the application becomes unavailable for the users and shows the error Page Unavailable.

h3. Expected Results
The page would keep loading until the export is finished. Ideally it would show a progress bar.

h3. Actual Results
The customer receives the error Page Unavailable, and is not able to get the PDF.
 
h3. Notes
This issue is more likely to happen when the page includes macros, as for example the Roadmap macro.

h3.Workaround
Might want to try to Space PDF export and only include the particular page in it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37954].
  {panel}

When creating service manually from bin/service.bat the script picks default JVM from Java home variable to service parameters. 

Consider windows system which by default have java 7 installed, and Java home is properly set - creating the service manually will connect confluence service to java 7, causing:
* at first Error Code 4 - which is linked to bad java option unsupported by java 7
* when all unsupported java options are removed Confluence fails to start due to class incompatibility

My suggestion is to always link the service to the java shipped with the installer.
fields.summary: Improvement to service.bat which creates confluence service (Confluence 5.8.4 x64 Windows)

h3. Summary
Attachment contains external data will *crash* Confluence JAVA while trying to render the attachment.

h3. Environment
Tested on both
* Confluence 5.6.4 Standalone 
* Confluence 5.8.4 Installer version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create an empty Confluence page
2. Attach provided XLSX file from the page [CSP-149837|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-149837]
3. Insert viewxls macro to the page and choose attached file to render
4. Save the page
5. Confluence JAVA crashes 

No error messages in the atlassian-confluence.log neither in tomcat logs.
 
h3. Workaround
Manually replace Office Connector macros containing problematic attachments with simple links to them.

h3. Notes
The xlxs contained a single chart external data range like  range like 'file:///some/windows/network/share/file.xlsx'#$'Sheet'.$E$2:$E$4;
